intro: Pfaffia luzuliflora f. gracilis, commonly known as the slender leaf feverfew, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is valued for its medicinal properties, particularly for its potential anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
